channel.title: Homes on Yifan Qian
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Yifan Qian

item.description: Short Bio I am currently a PhD student at the School of Business and Management in Queen Mary University of London, United Kingdom. My research is broadly concerned with computational social science and combines theories and methods from network science, sociology, machine learning and data science. The general goal of my work is to better understand the structure, functioning and consequences of complex large-scale networks across a number of empirical domains including citation networks, social networks and collaboration networks.

item.title: News
item.description: Lightning talk: Geometric deep learning with graphs at 2nd UK Network Science Workshop, 26 October 2018, London, UK. See my slides here. Poster: Geometric deep learning with graphs at IC2S2 2018, 13-15 July 2018, Evanston, Illinois, US. See my poster here. Poster: Geometric deep learning with graphs at NetSci 2018, 13-15 June, 2018, Paris, France. See my poster here. Contributed talk: Geometric deep learning with graphs at NetSci 2018 Satellite on Machine Learning in Network Science, 11-12 June, 2018, Paris, France.

item.title: Ongoing work
item.description: [Graph neural networks] Linking the classification performance of Graph Convolutional Networks with the alignment of graphs and features. [Social capital] Intra- and inter-brokerage in social networks. [Social capital] The structural foundations of creativity: A network-based study of co-productions among Italian theaters. [Geo-social networks] Measuring the social diversity of cities in mobility and scientific collaboration networks.

item.title: Collaborators
Teaching
item.description: I am teaching associate for the following courses: BUS346: Social Network Analysis (QMUL, 2019)
